title: Background Image - Add your Photo
custom_preconds: Given the user is in My Journal
custom_expected: Then the user will see an option to add a photo at the top of the page (pencil icon)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the content on the screen loads
And the user taps on the pencil icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a Pop up will be displayed asking the user to allow pictures and recordings
And the user will have the option to allow or deny

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the content on the screen loads
And the user taps on the pencil icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be given 3 options:
- add photo from existing library
- import from facebook
- take Photo
And the user will be able to add an image to the background

title: Changing My Journal background image
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And the user has previously set a background image
custom_expected: Then the user will be prompted to take a photo or select a photo from the gallery

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the pencil icon on the bottom right of the image
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be prompted to add existing, take new photo, or import from facebook

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has completes changing the photo
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the journal's background image should change immediately

title: No Check-Ins or Added Games
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on My Journal
And the user hasn't made any Check-Ins
or added any games
custom_expected:
Then the user will see '0' under Ballparks stats
And the user will see '0' under Teams stats

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the journal should not display any games checked in below

title: Most recently uploaded photos - the user has uploaded 0 photos
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And the user has not uploaded any photos
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a photos section
And there will be a camera icon with a message stating, 'You have not uploaded any photos yet'

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the photo button should remain the same 
And the photo gallery should be empty
And the user should see the gallery page with a "you have not uploaded any photos yet" text

title: Message the user sees when they have no history
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on My Journal
And the user has no check-ins
custom_expected: Then the user will not see any games in their journal history

title: offers
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user wants to check offers are working correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user checks the top right side of the header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the offer button
And the user will see a price tag icon

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the offer button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be directed to the offer page
And the user will see the header with arrow back on the top left
And the user will see his/her offers in cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the offers
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the offer detail webview
And the user will see the header with arrow back on the top left
And the user will see the details of the offer on the internal webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user taps on the back button on the device or header on the offer detail webview
(test both cases)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the offer page
And the user will see all the offers he/she has collected

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user taps on the back button on the device or header on the offer page
(test both cases)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the journal

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user exits the journal
And the user checks in to a ballpark
And the ballpark has offers that are unlocked through check in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should have the offer unlocked
And the user will see the offer when they go to the offer page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the offer has an expiration date
And the user is on the offer page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the offer is removed from the offer page
And the user should no longer be able to use the offer

title: map view
refs: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-1316, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-347, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-1312, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-1315, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-1313, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-1601
custom_preconds: Given the user wants to check out what ballparks he/she has visited over the many years of using the ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has no check-ins
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the "View on Map" button will be hidden.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has at least 1 check-in
And the user taps on the map view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following:
- back button on the top left of the header
- the header will have "your check-ins"
- google map will load and the screen will be on USA on default
- photo of either the ballpark or the photos attached to any check-in will appear on the map directly above where the ballpark is

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has a check-in on one ballpark with no photos attached
And a check-in on another ballpark with an image attached
And multiple check-ins on another ballpark with no photos attached to any of them
And multiple check-ins on another ballpark with several different photos attached to each check-in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- the map view will display multiple frames
- the ballpark with a check-in with no image will display the ballpark image on default
- the ballpark with a check-in with image will display the latest image on the frame

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a frame in the map view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the check-in list appear
And the use will see the following:
- total check-ins listed at the top cell
- the the ballpark the user tapped on
- a close button on the left side of the top cell
- a section with a list of all check-ins
- a cell within the section that displays the check-in information
( should display in this format
18, june 2015 
NYM 3, NYY 4)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the check-in cells
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the event detail view
And the event detail view should mirror the one thats in the journal(just check to see all elements are showing on the event detail view)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the device back from the event detail view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be brought back to the map view
And the user should see the list of check-ins that the user was looking at last

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps and hold on the map with 2 fingers
And spread them apart
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will zoom in

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps and pinch on the map with 2 finger
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will zoom out

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user double taps on the map view in quick succession
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will zoom in

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on any of the ballpark frames on the map view
and the user taps on a different ballpark frame
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will first see the check-in list for the first ballpark
And after the second tap the check-in list will populate for the second ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user has check-ins from decommissioned ballparks
- busch stadium 1 and 2
- yankee stadium
- RFK stadium
- shea stadium
- humphrey metrodome
And the user checks the map view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be able to find all the old ballparks in the map view
And the GPS location will be correct on each of the old decommissioned ballparks

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has check-ins to game/non-game events outside of the United States
(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Major_League_Baseball_games_played_outside_North_America)
- Tokyo dome
- SCG
- Estadio de Béisbol Monterrey
And the user is on the map view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the ballparks show up on the map in the correct GPS locations
And the user should see the last image ever attached to the event on the thumbnail
And the user should be able to tap on the thumbnail to reveal all events the user checked-in to for that ballpark
And the user should be able to navigate to the event detail for each event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the device back when the check-in list is open
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to the journal

title: Avatar
custom_preconds: Given user wants to add an avatar photo to his journal

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user first gets to the journal
And the user taps on the small frame located on the bottom left side
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be prompted 3 choices:
- import from facebook
- choose from photo library
- take photo

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has an avatar photo on his/her facebook account
And the user taps import from facebook
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be prompted to login to facebook if the user has not already done so
And the user will load the facebook avatar on to the journal avatar

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has an avatar photo
And the user taps on the avatar photo
And the user selects either the "choose from photo library" or "take photo"
And the user uploads an image
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user's avatar will update and change

title: Links to Stats
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
and the content on the screen loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps 'Ballparks' Stats cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Ballparks Stats page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps 'Teams' Stats cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Team Stats page

title: Total Visits when this number is greater than 0
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And has checked in to at least 1 game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a 'Total Check-Ins' Cell 
And there will be a number within this cell
And this number will be the total number of ballpark check-ins plus added historical games

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the ballpark total visit number show the correct amount of visits the user has made in total

title: Ballparks when this number is greater than 0
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And has checked in to at least 1 game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a cell titled 'Ballparks'
And there will be a number in this cell
And this number will be the total number of ballpark check-ins plus added historical games

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the journal page should display the correct number of ballparks the user has visited on the ballpark stats page button

title: Teams when this number is greater than 0
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And has checked in to or added at least 1 game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a cell titled 'Teams'
And there will be a number in this cell
And this number will be the total number of teams seen for check-ins and added historical games

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the team stats page button show the correct number of teams that he/she has watched

title: The Stats Page
custom_preconds: Given the user navigates to Stats
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a selector at the top for Ballparks and Teams (ballparks is default)
And a count for Ballparks, Total Visits 
And a list of stadiums visited sorted most visited to least

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the stats page
And the user will see the header with arrow back
And the user will see either the team or ballpark stats

title: Ballparks Tab - Updating stats when adding or checking in
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Stats
and the user has selected Ballparks
custom_expected:
Then the number next to Ballparks will increase by 1 (unless the user has already checked into or added a game at this same stadium)
and the number next to Total Visits will increase by 1 (always)
and the number next to the stadium's image and name will increase by 1 (always)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user checks into a game
or the user adds a game in History

(check both cases)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will have the stats of ballpark and team information updated

title: Ballparks Tab - Updating stats when removing added games
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Stats
and the user has selected Ballparks
and the user has added a historical game
custom_expected:
Then the number next to Ballparks will decrease by 1 (unless the user has already checked into or added another game at this same stadium)
and the number next to Total Visits will decrease by 1 (always)
and the number next to the stadium's image and name will decrease by 1 (always)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user removes a game from their History
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stats page for both ballpark and team will update accordingly

title: Ballparks Tab - Name, City, & State
custom_preconds:
Given the user has added and/or checked into games
and the user is in Stats
and the user has selected Ballparks
custom_expected:
Then the user will see an image of the stadium
and the name of the stadium will be to the right of it
and the city, state will be underneath the stadium name in lighter text

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the ballpark's visited list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the subnav under ballpark highlighted
And the user will see all the ballparks visited
And next to each ballparks it will number out the amount of times they visited said ballpark

title: Ballparks Tab - Specific ballpark visit totals
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Stats
and the user has selected Ballparks
custom_expected: Then the number to the right of the stadium in the stadium list will increase by 1

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user checks into a game
or the user adds a game in History for a stadium

(check both cases)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the ballpark total visit update accordingly

title: 1_EDITED Ballparks Tab - Verify the Ballpark thumbnails
custom_preconds: Given the user is in Stats
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the correct thumbnail for each stadium
(check for all teams)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/2551)![](index.php?/attachments/get/2550)![](index.php?/attachments/get/2552)![](index.php?/attachments/get/2553)![](index.php?/attachments/get/2554)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the list of visited ballparks
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see all the ballparks
And the user should see the correct images for each of the ballparks

title: 1_EDITED Ballparks Tab - Verify images for historical ballparks
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in with oldstadiums@mlb.com / tester
and the user is in Stats on the Ballparks tab

The stadium names in the stats list use the final name of the stadium before it was closed. The stadium names in the journal list use the stadium name at the time of the event. i.e Miami, that particular stadium changed names to Sun Life after 2005 and ended it's baseball status with that name. Marlins Park is not a stadium rename but a new venue entirely.
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the correct images for the historical ballparks:
- Twins 2005 The Metrodome
- Nationals 2005 RFK Stadium
- Mets 2005 Shea Stadium
- 2014 Sydney Cricket Ground (Australia)
- 2012 Tokyo Dome (Japan)
- Cardinals 2005 Old Busch Stadium
- Yankees 2005 Old Yankee Stadium
- Marlins 2005 Dolphins Stadium or 2004 Pro Player Stadium (please note you will see a Dolphin Stadium game (2005) or Pro Player Stadium game (2004) on 
   the Journal page, but it will show up in the Stat's Ballpark list as Sun Life Stadium because they share a venue id)


![](index.php?/attachments/get/2559) ![](index.php?/attachments/get/2560)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls through the ballpark list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see all the old ballpark images

title: Teams Tab - Verify drop down menu to sort stats
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
and the user has tapped on Stats
and the user has then tapped on the Team tab
custom_expected: Then the user will see an option to sort by All Teams, Home Teams, or Away Teams.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the All Teams drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see all teams listed out

title: Teams Tab - Verify each option is sorting correctly
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
and the user has tapped on Stats
and the user has then tapped on the Team tab
custom_expected:

and it will be in descending order based on amount of visits

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the All Teams drop down
and the user selects each option
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stats page will filter out the teams correctly

and the user has tapped on Stats

custom_expected:
Then all team logos and team names are correct and up to date
(check all teams)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the All Teams from the drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see all the team stats listed out
And the user will see the correct logo/name for each team shown on the stats page

title: Teams Tab - Updating stats when adding or checking in

Given the user is in Stats
and the user has selected Teams
custom_expected:
Then the Overall Home Team Record will update correctly
and the individual team record will update correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user checks into a game
or the user adds a game in History

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team stats should update accordingly

custom_expected:
Then the Overall Home Team Record will update correctly
and the individual team record will update correctly

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the users stats should update accordingly

title: Tapping the Journal (back) button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Journal
and the user has tapped either "Ballparks" or "Teams"
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought back to My Journal

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the back button at the top left
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be returned back to the journal

title: Link to photo gallery when the user has uploaded at least 1 image
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And the user has uploaded at least 1 image in the past
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Photos page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the photos button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the photo gallery
And the user will see all the image(s) he/she uploaded

title: Most recently uploaded photos - the user has uploaded at least 2
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And the user has uploaded at least 2+ photos
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the 8 most recent photos from left to right
And they will be scrollable

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the photo button on the journal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be on the photo gallery
And the user will see the latest image appear at the very top left side

title: Clicking on a Photo
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And the user has uploaded at least one photo

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a thumbnail in Photo
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the photo will open

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user swipes through the gallery
custom_steps_separated.expected: The user will be able to swipe through all their photos in the gallery smoothly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the photo
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then this will bring up the option to delete the photo

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the back button on the top left
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Photos page

title: Accessing the Gallery
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And the user has uploaded at least 2 photos
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought to the Gallery
And the photos will be sorted from latest to oldest

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the photo button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the photo gallery
And the user will see all the images he/she uploaded

title: Tapping Journal (Back) Button
custom_preconds: Given the user is in Gallery
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought back to My Journal

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user clicks on the Photos back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to the previous page

title: Tapping Delete Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Gallery
And the user has clicked on a Photo

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user clicks on the trash can icon on the bottom of the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be prompted with a confirmation window
And the window will have a Confirm and Cancel button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Confirm button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then this will remove the photo from the gallery
And the user will be taken to the next photo in the gallery

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Cancel button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then this will dismiss the window

title: multiple photos on journal history
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has checked in to many games
And the user has many photos added to many different events

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scrolls down to a game with more than 1+ images
And the user swipes on the image from right to left
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to flip through all images attached to that specific event

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scrolls down to a game that has at least 1 image
And the user taps on the image
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the app will open an event specific gallery
And the gallery will have an all black background
And the header will have an arrow back as well as a counter(EG: 1 of 3) on the top left
And the header will have a delete button(trash can icon) on the top right
And the image will be displayed in full

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scrolls down to a game that has at least 1 image
And the user goes in to the event specific gallery
And the user swipes from right to left and vise versa
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to flip through all the images

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scrolls to the end of the event specific gallery
And the user attempts to swipe from left to right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the gallery should not infinite scroll
And the user should still be on the last image

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user arrow back or device back(test both cases) from the event specific gallery
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be brought back to the journal view

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the event specific gallery
And the user taps on the delete button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a confirmation prompt up about deleting that specific image

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the event specific gallery
And the user taps on the delete button
And the user confirms he/she wants to delete the photo
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be back on the event specific gallery and the image should have been removed
And the counter at the top for total image should decrease by 1

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the journal
And the user taps on any event cell on the journal history
And the user taps on the "see all" photos button
And the user taps on either the camera icon or film icon and adds multiple images
And the user goes back to the journal history
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the cell for that specific event with an image attached
And the image should appear right below the event information
And the user should be able to scroll through all images attached to the game

title: Photo detail view
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on any gallery
and the user wants to check out the photo's info

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any photo
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the photo detail view
And the user will see the following:
- black background
- a back button on the top left
- a remove button on the top right
- directly below the top will show the current photo user is on out of total photos he/she has
(1 of 10 format)
- The photo directly beneath the photo count
- below the photo will display the uploaded date
all information below will be optional
- comments
- match information(mets vs cubs E.G.) home team will always dy firstispla
- ballpark the image was loaded from

title: uploading photo flow
custom_preconds:
given the user wants to upload a generic photo
And the user is on the photo gallery

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user taps on the photo icon on the top right side of the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be prompted 2 options:
- Choose photo
- take a new photo

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user chooses to upload an existing photo
And the user chooses a photo from the defaulted app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be directed to the photo confirmation page
And the user will see the following:
- back button on the top left
- upload and edit button on the top right
- image at the center of the page(the image should fit within the page without losing resolution or getting blurry)

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user taps upload on the confirmation page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be directed back to the gallery
And the user will see the recently uploaded photo represented in the small 1x1 photo thumbnail
And the user will see the recently uploaded photo whited out with a blue progress bar at the bottom of the thumbnail

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user taps on that thumbnail to force pause the upload
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the pause icon appear on the thumbnail
And the progress bar will stop moving

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the same tile again to resume the upload
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user pause icon will be removed
and the photo will continue to upload the image

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user force the upload to fail by dropping network connection or by making it time out with low bandwidth
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a small notification informing the user the photo upload has failed
And the user will see a refresh icon appear on the thumbnail
And the user will be able to refresh the upload and start it up again

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user restarts the upload and it completes without a hitch
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the white gradient should be removed from the thumbnail
And the user should be able to tap on that same thumbnail to go in to photo detail view

title: Photo editing/uploading flow
custom_preconds:
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-796 
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-801 
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-804 
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-810
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-800
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-807

Given the user want to edit/upload a photo

NOTE:
This is covering BPG,Event Detail, check-in,and photo Gallery edit/upload flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the ballpark guide
And the user taps the photo icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be prompted 2 choices
- choose photo(from storage)
- take photo(take new photo)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects "choose photo"
And the user selects an app to pull the photo from(if the app is not defaulted)
And the user selected a photo to upload
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the photo preview
And the user will see the following:
- back button on the top left
- upload and add frame on the top right
- the preview image below the header

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the upload button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the ballpark guide
And the app will display a notification that informs the user upload is in progress

custom_steps_separated.content: When the upload is done
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a notification that informs the user the upload was successful
And the user will have the option to either:
- 'View' (tapable on the notification)
- dismiss the notification by swiping it away

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on "View"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the journal gallery
And the user will see the most recent photo on the top left side of the gallery

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the back button
And the user taps the photo button on the ballpark guide
And the user taps the "take photo"
And the user takes a brand new photo
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the photo preview

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the add frame on the photo preview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the crop photo view
And the user will see the following:
- back button and header on the top left
- apply button on the top right
- preview image below the header
- thumbnail carousel

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the thumbnails in the carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will switch between stickers
And the user will see the preview image switch between the sticker to show users what their images is going to look like

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the thumbnail that he/she likes and taps on apply on the top right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the save & share view
And the user will see the following:
- back button with header on the top left
- a check button on the top right
- modified image right below the header
- caption input field
- sharing section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user adds caption on the save & share view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the character count on the right side increment accordingly
And the caption field will expand when the user either taps the return key or if the user type more than 57-58 characters(this might be different depending on device's resolution)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on any of the share options listed below the caption field(assuming the user has already linked the social media accounts)
and the user taps the check button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the ballpark guide page
And the user will see the in progress notification
And once the upload is complete then the user will see photo upload successful notification with the option to 'View'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps View on the upload successful notification
and the user navigates to the photo gallery in the journal
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the modified photo display on the top left

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the photo
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the photo detail view
And the user will be see the modified image along with the caption, date of photo upload, and the ballpark the image is associated with

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user goes to the event detail view of either any preview game or live game (both games that are within the window to check-in)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the photo section appear directly below the At Bat promo link

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user goes to the event detail view of a final game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the photo section appear
And user should Not see an At Bat promo link

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the photo icon on the event detail view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be prompted the 2 options
- choose photo
- take photo

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user picks one of those choices
And the user enters the photo preview
And the user taps on the add frame on the photo preview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the crop view
And the user will be able to sets how much he/she want to crop off the photo

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the any of the corners on the blue outline square box
And the user drags their finger up/down left/right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to adjust exactly how much they want to crop off

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user sets the amount he/she wants to crop
and the user taps the next button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the sticker view
And the user will be able to tap on any of the thumbnails to preview what the stickers looks like on the cropped photo

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects a sticker and hits apply
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be moved to the save & share view
and the user will be able to add captions and enable options to share to social media

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user adds no caption
and the user does not enable any of the sharing options
and the user taps the check button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the event detail view
and the user will see a small message that says "uploading photo ...."
and the user will see the modified photo appear in the photo section on the event detail

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the thumnbnail of the recently uploaded photo
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the photo detail view
And the user will see information on when the photo was uploaded, event matchup associated to the photo, and the ballpark that is associated to the event

Matchup information should be Home @ Away in 1 line

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user exits the photo detail view
And the user taps on the check-in button(assuming the user is on the event detail view for a game that is currently live, or within the 4 hour window)
And the user navigates to the check-in form
And the user taps on the photo icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will go through the same photo selection flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has gone through the photo selection flow
and the user tapped on the add frame on the photo preview
and the user cropped the photo to size on the crop view
and the user added a sticker to the cropped photo
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the check-in form instead of the save & share view
And the user will be able to complete the check-in form as expected

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the check-in button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user's modified check-in photo will appear in the user's gallery
and the photo will have the upload date, event matchup, and the ballpark the event took place on the photo detail view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the photo gallery
and the user taps on the top right photo icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will go through the photo selection flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has selected a photo
And the user goes through the normal upload/edit flow the event detail or ballpark guide follows above
And the user uploads a modified image
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the will be brought back to the photo gallery
And the user will see the photo thumbnail appear in white with a blue progress bar at the bottom

custom_steps_separated.content: When the photo has sucessfully uploaded the image
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the modified photo
And the user will see the date the photo was uploaded on the photo detail view

title: photo sharing
refs: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-796, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-801, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-804, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-810, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-800, https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-807
custom_preconds: given the user wants to share photos through social media

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user goes to the ballpark guide
and the user taps on the photo button
and the user goes through the editing flow until they hit the save & share page
and the user taps on any of the social sharing options
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be prompted to login and link/grant access to the app

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user login and enable the sharing option
and the user completes the photo uploading flow
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will post the photo to all social media options enabled and the user's journal

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user goes to the event detail view
and the user taps on the photo icon
and the user goes through the normal editing flow until they hit the save & share page
and the user taps on any of the social sharing options
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the social media icons will switch to an enabled state since since it was linked previously

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user completes the editing/uploading flow
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will post the photo to all social media options enabled and the user's journal

title: Link to view history
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And has added or checked into a game
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the History page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scrolls down to the History section
And the user taps on any of the history cells
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the event detail view for that game
And the user will be able to view all images attached to the game
And the user will be able to view all the game hightlights
And the user will be able to view the game wrap up

title: Most recent checked in or added games
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in My Journal
And the user has checked into or added games
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the games that they have checked in to or added
And the games will be listed in descending order from most recent checked in to or added
And tapping on any game will open the History page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the content on the screen loads
And the user scrolls down to the History Section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the checked in/added game show up in order based on date from latest at the top to the oldest at the bottom

title: Tapping the add game button
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the journal view
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Add Game search screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the add game button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the search page

title: Back from Add Games screen
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in journal
And the user has clicked '+ Add Game'
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought back to the History Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user clicks back button on the Add Games screen
Or taps the device hardware back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to journal

title: Screen will scroll
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has added or checked into enough games to fill more than one page
custom_expected: Then this page will allow the user to scroll through all the games they've added/checked into

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the app should scroll smoothly
And the checked in or added games should appear in order of latest to oldest game

title: Clicking on a cell opens Event Detail: Added Game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the journal
And the user scrolled down to the history section
custom_expected: Then the Event Detail screen will open for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a game that they have added or checked into (check both)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the event detail view

title: Photo was not uploaded
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the journal
And the user has added or checked into at least one game
And the user has not uploaded a photo to this game
custom_expected: Then the user will not see a photo associated with this game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the content on the screen loads
And the user scrolls to the game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the checked in/added game with no image attached on the game cell in the history section

title: Photo was uploaded
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added or checked into at least one game
And the user uploaded a photo to this game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the photo they uploaded to this game
And verify that this is the correct photo 
And the user will see the photo beneath the date
And below the score

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the content on the screen loads
And the user scrolls to the game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the game cell with the first image attached to the cell

title: No option to remove game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has checked into one or more games
custom_expected: Then the user will not see an option to remove this game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the journal page loads completely
And the user taps on a game that they have checked in to live (GPS location on the date of the game, i.e. NOT historical check in)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should not see a remove button on the event detail view

title: Check-In Icon
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has checked into at least one game live on game date with GPS location (NOT historical checkin)
custom_expected: Then the user will see the check-in icon on the bottom right of the cell

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the scrolls down till he sees the checked in game
And the user views the checked in game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see a location icon at the bottom right side of the cell

title: check-in comment or message
custom_preconds: Given the user wants to see the comment he made when checking in

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the check-in form
And the user adds a comment while checking in
And the user checks in
And the user navigates back to the journal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see all games checked in
And the user will see the game he recently checked in to will display the comment right below the ballpark info

title: No Icon indicators
custom_preconds:
Given the user has added at least one historical game
And the user has not checked in to any games
And the user is on the journal
custom_expected: Then the user will never see the checked in icon located at the bottom right of the cell

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the added game(s)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should not see the location icon appear on the game cell

title: Game Date
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added or checked into at least one game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the date of the game at the top of the cell
And the upper left corner will have the 'DD' of the game
And one space over will have the 'Month'   
And to the upper right corner will be the 'Year' of the game
And the font of this text will be bolded and larger than the other font in the cell

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls down to the game that was added
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the day and month of the game on the top left side
And the year on the top right side

title: Game Score
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added or checked into at least one game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the score of the game
And the score will be listed in the following matter [awayTeamName awayTeamScore , homeTeamName homeTeamScore]

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls to the game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the game score at the bottom of the cell
And the score will be shown this format (away team 2,home team 3)

title: Game Stadium Location - Stadium Image
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added or checked into at least one game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the name of the Ballpark in which this game took place 
And this will be located above the score
And to the right of the stadium image

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls to the game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user should see the stadium/ballpark image on the left side of the cell
And the user should see the the ballpark name, city, and state appear in grey right next to the image

title: Game Location
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added or checked into at least one game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the location of the game
And it will be City, State (abbreviated state)
And it will be located to the right of the name of the ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls to the game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the ballpark the game was played in next to the stadium image

title: Remove Game Button Exists for added games only
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added at least one game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a 'Remove' button at the top right of the Event Detail page for that game 
And this button will not appear for any Checked In games

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scrolls down to the game they have added
And the user taps on that game to bring up the Event Detail page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the remove button appear on added games only

title: Back Functionality
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added at least one game
And the user has tapped on the game to be removed on the History page
And the user taps on the 'Remove' button on the Event Detail page
custom_expected: Then the user is returned to the History page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is prompted with a Delete Game
And user taps on the back button
Or the device hardware back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to the journal's history

title: Clicking the Remove Game Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And has added or checked into at least one game
And the user has tapped on the game to be removed
And the user taps on the 'Remove' button on the Event Detail page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see 'Successfully Updated'
And the user will notice the game is removed from their history section

ORIGINAL:
Then the user will notice the game is removed from their history section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the "Delete Game" button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the deleted game page
And the user will see a message that reads "successfully updated"

title: Find Games Fields
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked '+ add game' button
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the following search fields: Year, Home Team, Away Team, Month, and Day; 
And Year and Home Team will be marked as required fields

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be on the add game page
And the user will see search fields that will assist the user in finding games

title: Cannot select a date in the future / New: Cannot add a date in the future
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in History
And the user has clicked '+ Add Game'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to add a future dated game
And taps on the Search For Games button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see games listed with a date greater than the current day.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a future dated game and taps on the Add game button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will get an alert stating "You can only add games that have already been played.  Please search again."

title: Query that returns 0 results
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked '+ Add Game'
And the user has filled in the required search fields
And the user has tapped Search For Games
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the Add Games screen
And there will be a message stating, 'No games found'

custom_steps_separated.content: When there are no games meeting the criteria searched for
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a message that reads "no games found"

title: Back Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked on + Add Game
And the user has entered in valid search criteria on the Add Games screen
And the user has has clicked Search For Games
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Add Games screen with the search criteria fields

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the screen loads displaying the games that match the users query
And the user clicks Back
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to the Add Game search page

title: Game Date and Teams
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked on '+ Add Game'
And the user has entered in valid search criteria on the Add Games Screen
And the user has has tapped Search for Games
custom_expected:
Then the top of every game's cell shows the date of the game in the following format
DAY, MONTH DATE, YEAR
And the bottom of every game's cell shows the teams playing in the following format
AWAY TEAM (nickname) vs. HOME TEAM (nickname)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the list of games on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the date and time of each game displayed in this format
*day of the week, month,day,year* EG: *Friday,  July 3, 2015*

title: Clicking the Add Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked on '+ Add Game'
And the user has entered in valid search criteria on the Add Games Screen
And the user has has clicked Search for Games
And has tapped on a game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on "Add game"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a message that reads "successfully updated"
And the user will see 2 options "add another" and "done"

title: Done Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked on '+ Add Game'
And the user has entered in valid search criteria on the Add Games Screen
And the user has tapped Search for Games
And the user has tapped on a game
And the user has tapped Add Game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the screen loads 
And the user taps "Done"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be directed back to the Journal's History Screen
And the user should be able to find the game in History by scrolling down

title: Adding more than one game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked on '+ Add Game'
And the user has entered in valid search criteria on the Add Games Screen
And the user has has clicked Search for Games
And the user has tapped on the game to add
And the user taps 'Add Game' on the confirmation page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is brought back to the Add Games screen with results
And the user taps on "Add another" button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the queryed games list
And the user will see a green check mark next to the game that was already added

title: Disclaimer Text
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the journal
And the user has clicked on '+ Add Game'
And the user has entered in valid search criteria
And the user has has tapped Search for Games

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user clicks on any game to add
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the disclaimer text appear beneath the game they want to add
